00040 /*  Types are defined for windows here  */
00041 typedef unsigned char     nitf_Uint8;
00042 typedef unsigned __int16  nitf_Uint16;
00043 typedef unsigned __int32  nitf_Uint32;
00044 typedef unsigned __int64  nitf_Uint64;
00045 
00046 typedef signed char       nitf_Int8;
00047 typedef __int16           nitf_Int16;
00048 typedef __int32           nitf_Int32;
00049 typedef __int64           nitf_Int64;
00050 typedef HANDLE            nitf_IOHandle;
00051 typedef HINSTANCE         NITF_NATIVE_DLL;
00052 typedef FARPROC           NITF_DLL_FUNCTION_PTR;
00053 typedef DWORD             nitf_AccessFlags;
00054 typedef DWORD             nitf_CreationFlags;
00055 /*  Determine the maximum file path length  */
00056 #      define  NITF_MAX_PATH     MAX_PATH
00057 
00058 /* use nitf_Off instead of off_t, since on Windows we want nitf_Int64 used */
00059 typedef nitf_Int64        nitf_Off;
00060 
00061 /*  IO macros  */
00062 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
00063 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE(I) ((I) == NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00064 #      define  NITF_SEEK_CUR         FILE_CURRENT
00065 #      define  NITF_SEEK_SET         FILE_BEGIN
00066 #      define  NITF_SEEK_END         FILE_END
00067 #      define  NITF_CREATE           OPEN_ALWAYS
00068 #      define  NITF_OPEN_EXISTING    OPEN_EXISTING
00069 #      define  NITF_TRUNCATE         OPEN_EXISTING
00070 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READONLY  GENERIC_READ
00071 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY GENERIC_WRITE
00072 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE GENERIC_READ|GENERIC_WRITE
00073 
00074 /* type suffixes */
00075 #      define  NITF_INT64(x) x##i64
00076

00080 *  Here, we define the basic libraries needed by
00081 *  all compilers (the non-platform specific code)

00094 /*  Typedefs on Unix are a different ball game */
00095 typedef uint8_t            nitf_Uint8;
00096 typedef uint16_t           nitf_Uint16;
00097 typedef uint32_t           nitf_Uint32;
00098 typedef uint64_t           nitf_Uint64;
00099

00101 typedef int16_t            nitf_Int16;
00102 typedef int32_t            nitf_Int32;
00103 typedef int64_t            nitf_Int64;

00105 typedef off_t              nitf_Off;

00107 typedef void*             NITF_DLL_FUNCTION_PTR;
00108 typedef void*             NITF_NATIVE_DLL;
00109 typedef int               nitf_AccessFlags;
00110 typedef int               nitf_CreationFlags;
00111 /*
00112 *  Under Unix, we want to provide default permissions.
00113 *  Some are nice enough to default to 0666, others just
00114 *  burn you, so we make it explicit
00115 */
00116 #      define  NITF_DEFAULT_PERM  0644
00117 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE -1
00118 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE(I) ((I) == NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00119 #      define  NITF_SEEK_CUR             SEEK_CUR
00120 #      define  NITF_SEEK_SET             SEEK_SET
00121 #      define  NITF_SEEK_END             SEEK_END
00122 #      define  NITF_CREATE               O_CREAT
00123 #      define  NITF_TRUNCATE             O_TRUNC
00124 #      define  NITF_OPEN_EXISTING        0
00125 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READONLY      O_RDONLY
00126 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY     O_WRONLY
00127 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE     O_RDWR
00128 
00129 
00130 /* type suffixes */
00131 #      define  NITF_INT64(x) x##LL
00132 
00133 #      if defined(HAVE_SYS_TIME_H)
00134 #           include <sys/time.h>
00135 #      endif
00136 
00137 /*
00138 *  On most systems, this gets included in limits.h, but sometimes its not
00139 *  there, so we make one up.  I figure we can easily get 1k on the stack,
00140 *  so if its not there, it gets set to that.
00141 */
00142 #      if defined(MAXPATHLEN)
00143 #          define NITF_MAX_PATH      MAXPATHLEN
00144 #      else
00145 #          define NITF_MAX_PATH      1024
00146 #      endif
00147 #endif

00151 #   define NITF_SUCCESS  (1)
00152 #   define NITF_FAILURE  (0)

00155 /* Enum for the supported version types */
00156 typedef enum _nitf_Version
00157 {
00158     NITF_VER_20 = 100,
00159     NITF_VER_21,
00160     NITF_VER_UNKNOWN
00161 } nitf_Version;
00162 
00163 typedef enum _nitf_CornersType
00164 {
00165     NITF_CORNERS_UNKNOWN = -1,
00166     NITF_CORNERS_UTM,
00167     NITF_CORNERS_UTM_UPS_S,
00168     NITF_CORNERS_UTM_UPS_N,
00169     NITF_CORNERS_GEO,
00170     NITF_CORNERS_DECIMAL
00171 } nitf_CornersType;
00172 
00173 /* These macros check the NITF Version */
00174 #define IS_NITF20(V) ((V) == NITF_VER_20)
00175 #define IS_NITF21(V) ((V) == NITF_VER_21)
00176 
00177 
00178 /*
00179  *  Finally, we determine what kind of system you
00180  *  are using, and come up with our own swap routines.
00181  *  This is to avoid the nasty mess that comes with
00182  *  (Unix actually) the non-standard socket include locations,
00183  *  and to avoid including sockets just to swap bytes (Ugh).
00184  */
00185 
00186 /* these functions are accessed if needed via the nitf_ntohs
00187    and nitf_ntohl macros defined in System.h                 */
00188 
00189 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint16) nitf_System_swap16(nitf_Uint16 ins);
00190 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint32) nitf_System_swap32(nitf_Uint32 inl);
00191 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint64) nitf_System_swap64(nitf_Uint64 inl);
00192 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint32) nitf_System_swap64c(nitf_Uint64 inl);
00193 
00194 /* Configure says we are big-endian */
00195 #if defined(__LITTLE_ENDIAN__) || !defined(WORDS_BIGENDIAN)
00196 
00197 #       define NITF_NTOHS(x)  nitf_System_swap16 (x)
00198 #       define NITF_HTONS(x)  nitf_System_swap16 (x)
00199 
00200 #       define NITF_NTOHL(x)  nitf_System_swap32 (x)
00201 #       define NITF_HTONL(x)  nitf_System_swap32 (x)
00202 
00203 #       define NITF_HTONLL(x) nitf_System_swap64(x)
00204 #       define NITF_NTOHLL(x) nitf_System_swap64(x)
00205 
00206 #       define NITF_HTONLC(x) nitf_System_swap64c(x)
00207 #       define NITF_NTOHLC(x) nitf_System_swap64c(x)
00208 
00209 #   else
00210 
00211 #       define NITF_NTOHS(x)  (x)
00212 #       define NITF_HTONS(x)  (x)
00213 
00214 #       define NITF_NTOHL(x)  (x)
00215 #       define NITF_HTONL(x)  (x)
00216 
00217 #       define NITF_HTONLL(x) (x)
00218 #       define NITF_NTOHLL(x) (x)
00219 
00220 #       define NITF_HTONLC(x) (x)
00221 #       define NITF_NTOHLC(x) (X)
00222 
00223 #   endif
00224 typedef void NITF_DATA;
